meanings.definition: A person who flatters or praises excessively in order to gain favor or approval.
meanings.sent1: The fawners surrounded the boss, showering him with compliments.
meanings.sent2: She could see through the insincere smiles of the fawners in the group.
meanings.sent3: The fawners at the party were like bees buzzing around the honey pot.
meanings.sent4: The fawners were like colorful birds trying to attract attention with their sweet songs.
meanings.sent5: The image of the fawners clinging to the celebrity for praise was hard to forget.

meanings.definition: To seek favor or approval through excessive flattery or praise.
meanings.sent1: He would fawners his way into getting what he wanted from his parents.
meanings.sent2: The politician fawners to the voters during the campaign.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to fawners its way into getting extra treats from its owner.
meanings.sent4: Her words fawners around him like a sweet melody, luring him in.
meanings.sent5: The student fawners the teacher with compliments to get a better grade.
